intro: Gilibertia intercedens, commonly known as the red sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy, ovate leaves. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Gilibertia intercedens is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil in degraded areas.
